Package BobcatLib.Hardware.Encoders

Class BaseEncoder

java.lang.Object
BobcatLib.Hardware.Encoders.BaseEncoder
public class BaseEncoder extends Object
A base class for interacting with an encoder using the EncoderIO interface. This class provides methods for configuring the encoder, retrieving its position, and managing faults.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    BaseEncoder(EncoderIO io)
    Constructs a new BaseEncoder instance with the specified encoder IO interface.

  • Constructor Details

    • BaseEncoder

      public BaseEncoder(EncoderIO io)
      Constructs a new BaseEncoder instance with the specified encoder IO interface.
      Parameters:
      io - the EncoderIO interface used to communicate with the encoder.

  • Method Details

    • periodic

      public void periodic()
      Periodically updates the encoder's inputs. This method should be called regularly to ensure accurate data.

    • configAbsEncoder

      public void configAbsEncoder()
      Configures the absolute encoder's sensor position and determines its inversion state. This method ensures the encoder is properly initialized for absolute position tracking.

    • getAbsolutePosition

      public double getAbsolutePosition()
      Retrieves the absolute position of the encoder.
      Returns:
      the absolute position in rotations, represented as a value in the range (-1 to 0) or (0 to 1).

    • factoryDefault

      public void factoryDefault()
      Resets the encoder to its factory default settings.

      Note: This method does not clear the stored zero offset of the encoder.

    • clearStickyFaults

      public void clearStickyFaults()
      Clears any sticky faults on the encoder. Sticky faults are errors that persist until explicitly cleared.

    • checkForFaults

      public void checkForFaults()
      Checks the encoder for faults and handles them as necessary. This method is called internally after critical operations.
